javax.swing

Class BufferStrategyPaintManager.BufferInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.ComponentAdapter
      • javax.swing.BufferStrategyPaintManager.BufferInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentListener, WindowListener, EventListener
    Enclosing class:
    BufferStrategyPaintManager

    private class BufferStrategyPaintManager.BufferInfo
extends ComponentAdapter
implements WindowListener
    BufferInfo is used to track the BufferStrategy being used for a particular Component. In addition to tracking the BufferStrategy it will install a WindowListener and ComponentListener. When the component is hidden/iconified the buffer is marked as needing to be completely repainted.

      • isInSync

        public boolean isInSync()
        Whether or not the contents of the buffer strategy is in sync with the window. This is set to true when the root pane paints all, and false when contents are lost/restored.

      • getRoot

        public Container getRoot()
        Returns the Root (Window or Applet) that this BufferInfo references.

      • getBufferStrategy

        public BufferStrategy getBufferStrategy(boolean create)
        Returns the BufferStartegy. This will return null if the BufferStartegy hasn't been created and create is false, or if there is a problem in creating the BufferStartegy.
        Parameters:
        create - If true, and the BufferStartegy is currently null, one will be created.

      • hasBufferStrategyChanged

        public boolean hasBufferStrategyChanged()
        Returns true if the buffer strategy of the component differs from current buffer strategy.

      • createBufferStrategy

        private BufferStrategy createBufferStrategy()
        Creates the BufferStrategy. If the appropriate system property has been set we'll try for flip first and then we'll try for blit.

      • createBufferStrategy

        private BufferStrategy createBufferStrategy(Container root,
                                  boolean isVsynced)

        Description copied from interface: WindowListener

      • windowActivated

        public void windowActivated(WindowEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: WindowListener
        Invoked when the Window is set to be the active Window. Only a Frame or a Dialog can be the active Window. The native windowing system may denote the active Window or its children with special decorations, such as a highlighted title bar. The active Window is always either the focused Window, or the first Frame or Dialog that is an owner of the focused Window.
        Specified by:
        windowActivated in interface WindowListener

      • windowDeactivated

        public void windowDeactivated(WindowEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: WindowListener
        Invoked when a Window is no longer the active Window. Only a Frame or a Dialog can be the active Window. The native windowing system may denote the active Window or its children with special decorations, such as a highlighted title bar. The active Window is always either the focused Window, or the first Frame or Dialog that is an owner of the focused Window.
        Specified by:
        windowDeactivated in interface WindowListener
